news.title: Conor McGregor not expected to face prosecution in alleged perjury inquiry
news.summary: Conor McGregor is not expected to face prosecution as part of a criminal inquiry into allegations of perjury related to his civil rape appeal.

news.title: RTÉ to pull Ireland out of Eurovision and will not broadcast song contest if Israel takes part, broadcaster confirms
news.summary: RTÉ will not screen any of the Eurovision Song Contest if Israel is not removed from the competition because of the war in Gaza.

news.title: Tenant living in Dublin city-centre apartment ordered to pay almost €70,000 in rent arrears
news.summary: A tenant renting an apartment in Dublin city centre has been ordered to vacate the property and pay nearly €70,000 in arrears.

news.title: Blow to Maria Steen’s Irish presidential hopes as Independent Ireland TDs hold back support
news.summary: Conservative activist Maria Steen suffered a major blow to her ­presidential hopes last night, just hours after announcing on the plinth at Leinster House that she had 10 Oireachtas backers and that her campaign was under way.

news.title: Ger Brennan’s Blue rule: Why his Dublin side must ‘die with their boots on’
news.summary: Ger Brennan, the player, was as tough as old boots. A baller, for sure, but abrasive when the occasion demanded too.

news.title: ‘I always wanted a place with a treehouse and its own island’
news.summary: The Old Rectory, Drumcar, Co Louth

news.title: Adrian Weckler: Search through social media reveals graphic videos of Charlie Kirk assassination can still be widely found – but why?
news.summary: Travelling through the US this week, I saw what seemed like an already febrile political atmosphere taken to a new level by graphic videos of an assassination and a subway murder.

news.title: The Indo Daily: 'The closest to war since WW II' - Is Europe on the brink of chaos?
news.summary: Polish prime minister Donald Tusk says the incursion of Russian drones into Polish airspace brings his country closer to military conflict “than any time since World War II”.

news.title: Tanya Sweeney: Listen up, guys, if a woman doesn’t want to talk to you, just move on and stop blaming the ‘ugly’ friend
news.summary: Last week, I learned a new online phrase, courtesy of the Men On The Internet: ‘the fridge protects the snacks’. The ‘snacks’ in question are young, hot, dateable women who are tasty, delectable, moreish. The ‘fridge’ part refers to their less attractive, more frumpy or larger, refrigerator-dimensioned friends. Charming, right?

news.title: Modern Morals: My boyfriend is weirdly close to his mum. How do I get him to stop telling her everything about us?
